content: sorbet poncho crochet pattern designed by pennymade january 16 2026 sorbet poncho sorbet poncho a summer mesh crochet poncho the sorbet poncho is a light airy top-down crochet poncho designed for warm weather it features a simple double_crochet mesh stitch and clean corner increases that create a relaxed breathable fabric this pattern is suitable for confident beginners who are comfortable with chaining and basic stitches and it s perfect for skill level cotton yarns and colorful summer palettes confident beginner materials 6 0 mm crochet hook approximately 400 g of #4 worsted weight yarn 3 stitch markers scissors yarn needle a finer yarn will produce a lighter more open fabric a heavier yarn will result in a denser drape adjust hook size as needed yardage will vary depending on yarn type hook size and finished length page 1 sorbet poncho terminology & stitches used this pattern uses us crochet terminology chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet notes before you begin this poncho is worked top-down in joined rounds do not turn your work the beginning chain 3 counts as a double_crochet double_crochet stitches are worked into chain spaces not into the tops of stitches all increases happen only at the corners this pattern uses 3 stitch markers not 4 fit reference for reference the sample shown was made with a shoulder width of 18 inches measured straight across from shoulder point to shoulder point the foundation chain of 104 stitches was chosen to create a wide relaxed neckline that sits almost off the shoulders page 2 sorbet poncho foundation chain 104 join to the first chain with a slip_stitch being careful not to twist your chain stitch marker placement after joining place stitch markers in the following stitches the 26th stitch the 52nd stitch the 78th stitch you do not need to place a marker at the joining stitch the joining point acts as the fourth corner because the beginning chain of each round naturally creates the increase round 1 chain 3 counts as double_crochet chain 1 skip 1 stitch double_crochet around at each stitch marker work double_crochet chain 2 double_crochet into the same stitch move the stitch marker into the chain-2 space at the joining point work double_crochet chain 1 join with a slip_stitch to the top of the beginning chain 3 page 3 sorbet poncho round 2 and following rounds chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet in the next chain-1 space chain 1 double_crochet in the next chain-1 space around at each corner chain-2 space work double_crochet chain 2 double_crochet into the chain-2 space this creates the increase and forms the corners join with a slip_stitch to the top of the beginning chain 3 repeat this round until the poncho reaches your desired length bottom border once the poncho is complete finish with the following two rounds border round 1 work one half_double_crochet in each stitch and chain space around join with a slip_stitch do not turn border round 2 single_crochet chain 1
